measure.title: Restrictions defining the operation of primary schools
measure.meta_description: Presence education is currently banned except for defined exceptions.

content.processed:
According to the 4th point, the government of the Czech Republic restricts the operation of primary schools according to the law defining rules for this area. Specifically, the government bans attendance on presence education with a valid exception for:

  • primary schools intended for children of medical workers,
  • primary schools intended for institutional or protective care,
  • participation in individual consultations (one student and one consultant).

Presence education must be organized in separated groups of students.

Full text of the decree (only in Czech).
